channel.title: Downloads Section
channel.description:
The downloads section needs a little help and fixing. For one, any registered member can post anything in the section whether it be about help, a download, a virus, or something not even related in any way... This is very annoying, if the download is a virus then a lot of the unsuspecting members who are most likely new will lose their computer, we have no clue how many people have downloaded a virus because of this site, when we should know that no one has. Two, back before we did the forum upgrade the tutorial section was highly moderated, all tutorials had to follow the format and rules of the section and then had to be approved to be seen by other members. I propose we add this to the download section so we can keep things clean a lot easier then having 10-30 threads that don't even belong or follow the rules of the section.
Comment with any hate against the idea, or love for it. Or just spam....

item.title: Downloads Section
item.dc:creator: @JavaTC JavaTC
item.description:
@JavaTC wrote:

Personally, I think it should be moderator approved topics. Mostly because it ensures that no one will get infected before a moderator can lock the topic. I know this increases the workload of moderators, however all they really would have to do is make sure it’s relevant to the board and ensure it’s not an obvious advertisement, virus, etc.

If people can’t wait 1 day for their topic to appear, they shouldn’t be posting it anyway, as it’s probably hybrid pvp with a few commands and they just want praise.

Yes, it will add a small amount onto the moderators workload, but think about how many servers are typically released a week, usually around 3 or 4 is what I’ve been seeing recently (I don’t get on near as much as I used to, though, so meh). So, it’s not like they’ll be swamped with reading threads every day, it’ll only take a few minutes each, as they don’t even have to read the whole topic, just skim it enough.

Just my thoughts

t4:

make only certain users with a number of posts and days registered be able to post in that section

That problematic for those who only register to release their servers, but spend all their time on R-S or R - L. Some of those servers are actually really good.

item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

Alright so, I agree with silabsoft. The real problem here is accessibility. By adding forced moderation to that section, everyone will be at a severe inconvenience, not to mention that the staff would have a significantly higher workload. Instead, all we can really do is post disclaimers (as she said) and encourage everyone to use the ‘report to moderator’ feature as much as possible. If you have and no moderator reacts to it within a few hours, please post such a concern in this section so we can figure out something else to do.

I personally think a change this large would put the users at too much of an inconvenience, though.
